security_audit.summary: Prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation for AI code review guidance. No executable code, scripts, or network calls. Operates as a system prompt instructing the AI to perform file reading and web research - appropriate for the stated purpose.

content.user_title: Review Code with Latest Ecosystem Research
content.value_statement: Code reviews may miss outdated dependencies or deprecated patterns. This skill performs deep analysis with real-time web research to verify versions, check security vulnerabilities, and validate against current documentation.
actual_capabilities: Verify latest stable versions of libraries and dependencies
Check security vulnerabilities in current dependency versions
Validate code patterns against official documentation
Detect deprecated APIs and recommend modern alternatives
Evaluate code correctness, edge cases, and error handling
Assess code elegance, naming clarity, and maintainability
limitations: Does not modify code or create pull requests
Requires project context files like CLAUDE.md for full standards check
Web research adds time to review process (2-3 minutes)

use_cases.title: Security vulnerability check
use_cases.description: Verify dependencies for known CVEs and security issues before merging code changes.

use_cases.title: Standards compliance review
use_cases.description: Ensure new code follows project patterns and uses current library best practices.

use_cases.title: Dependency version audit
use_cases.description: Check if dependencies are outdated and identify needed upgrades.

prompt_templates.title: Quick version check
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if our React and TypeScript versions are current. Search for latest stable releases.

prompt_templates.title: Security audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Review our dependencies for security issues. Search for known vulnerabilities in current versions.

prompt_templates.title: Pattern verification
prompt_templates.prompt: Verify our React patterns against the latest documentation. Flag any deprecated usage.

prompt_templates.title: Full code review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review the recent changes for correctness, elegance, and standards compliance. Check versions and documentation.

best_practices: Use when merging dependency updates or adding new libraries
Combine with automatic quality hooks for comprehensive coverage
Request web research explicitly with 'double check against latest' trigger
anti_patterns: Using for simple syntax reviews (automatic hook handles this faster)
Expecting code modifications (skill provides recommendations only)
Skipping project context files (reduces standards compliance accuracy)

faq.question: What platforms support this skill?
faq.answer: Works with Claude, Codex, and Claude Code. Requires web search capability.

faq.question: How long does a review take?
faq.answer: Typically 2-3 minutes due to web research for version and documentation verification.

faq.question: Does this modify my code?
faq.answer: No. The skill provides recommendations and findings but does not write or change files.

faq.question: Is my code data safe?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a prompt-based skill with no external network calls or data exfiltration.

faq.question: How is this different from automatic quality hooks?
faq.answer: Automatic hooks use existing knowledge for fast checks. This skill performs deep web research for current versions and documentation.

faq.question: What triggers should I use?
faq.answer: Say 'double check against latest docs', 'verify versions', 'check security', or 'review against documentation'.
